intro: Senecio acutidens, commonly known as the sharp-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It features slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Senecio acutidens produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
